yacx

Class HalfArg

  • java.lang.Object
    • yacx.JNIHandle
      • yacx.KernelArg
        • yacx.ArrayArg
          • yacx.HalfArg

  • public class HalfArg
extends ArrayArg
    Class representing an half-array-argument for the kernel.
    The passed float-arguments will be converted to halfs. Note the possibility of accuracy loss while conversion to half.
    Required CUDA-device with CUDA version 6 or higher.
    Note: The size in bytes for one half-element is fixed and may differ from the size of the corresponding data-type in CUDA, which is depending on your system. So make sure the size of the corresponding data-type is matching SIZE_BYTES to avoid unexpected segmentation faults.

      Size in bytes for one element.

        columns - amount of columns of the matrix
        Returns:
        a new HalfArg with the passes values

      • createOutput

        public static HalfArg createOutput(int length)

        This argument will be allocating enough memory for length half-elements.

        Returns:
        a new HalfArg

      • slice

        public HalfArg slice(int start,
                     int end)
        Description copied from class: ArrayArg
        Slices the array.
        This creates a new ArrayArg corresponding to a new C-KernelArg-Object, but using the same memory for the array.
        If the content of this ArrayArg changed, the content of the created ArrayArg will be changed too. In the other direction as well.
        Specified by:
        slice in class ArrayArg
        Parameters:
        start - index of the first element for the new array
        end - index of the last element for new array
        Returns:
        a new ArrayArg using the same memory for the array
